intro: Mitrasacme micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
